official-title.#text:
To amend the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 to authorize the Secretary of Housing
			 and Urban Development to carry out a loan repayment program for certain
			 architects, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title I of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may establish and carry out a loan repayment program for eligible architects (in this
			 section referred to as the

quote.#tail: ) who provide eligible design services on behalf of a Community Design Center.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that contains—

text.#text:
To be eligible to participate in the loan repayment program, an eligible architect shall enter into
			 a written contract with the
an agreement under which—

the eligible architect agrees to provide eligible design services on behalf of a Community Design
			 Center for a period of not shorter than 1 year; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
agrees to make payments on the principal and interest of qualifying educational loans
			 of the eligible architect in an amount to be determined by the

for the period of time the eligible architect provides such eligible
			 design services;

text.#text: the

a provision that any financial obligation of the United States arising out of a contract entered
			 into under this subsection and any obligation of the eligible architect
			 which is conditioned thereon, is contingent upon funds being appropriated
			 for the loan repayment program under this section; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
if the
			 eligible architect breaches the contract.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974/s:5322/ss:f

text.#text: a statement of the damages to which the United States is entitled under

term.#tail: means research or design services as follows:

text.#text: The term

The design, including the preparation of construction documents, of housing facilities, schools,
			 health clinics, libraries, community centers, and other public facilities
			 (except for buildings used for the general conduct of government).
The development of comprehensive long-range community development plans.

The development of plans for neighborhoods that are appropriate for rehabilitation or conservation
			 activities, including neighborhoods that are blighted, deteriorated, or
			 deteriorating.
The preservation or rehabilitation of historic sites.

The design, including the preparation of construction documents, of building retrofits for energy
			 and water efficiency and conservation improvements.

Assessment of the safety of structures that are in disrepair or have been damaged as the result of
			 natural or manmade disasters.

The design of improvements that remove architectural barriers which restrict the mobility of
			 elderly individuals and individuals with disabilities.
Plans for the redevelopment of traditional main streets and business districts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may determine.

a statement of the amount of compensation the eligible architect will receive from the Community

text.#text: The

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide remedies for any breach of such contract by an
			 eligible architect, including repayment or partial repayment of financial
			 assistance received with interest.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974/s:5322/ss:b

text.#text: A contract described in

Funds recovered under this paragraph shall be credited to the account available to carry out this
			 section and shall remain available until expended.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may grant a waiver of any repayment obligation for breach of contract in the event of
			 extreme hardship or extreme need, as determined by the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop regulations to determine the amount of loan repayment for 1 year of
			 service by an eligible architect. In making the determination, the

shall maximize the number of contracts that can be provided
			 under the program from the amounts appropriated for such contracts.

text.#text: The

Loan repayments provided under this section may consist of payments on behalf of eligible
			 architects of the principal and interest on government and commercial
			 loans received by the eligible architect for attendance at an accredited
			 masters program in architecture, which loans were made for—
tuition expenses;

all other reasonable educational expenses, including fees, books, technology, and studio expenses
			 incurred by the eligible architect; or
reasonable living expenses as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may contract with an eligible architect’s loan provider for the payment to the loan
			 provider, on behalf of the eligible architect, of the amount of a loan
			 repayment described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974/s:5322/ss:f/p:3

text.#text: The

Nothing in this section shall be construed to allow a Community Design Center to prepare building
			 plans or construction documents that do not comply with applicable State
			 and local laws and regulations related to building codes and permits.
In this section the following definitions shall apply:

term.#tail:
means a non-profit organization operated and managed by a licensed architect that conducts
			 research and provides eligible design services for community development
			 projects.

text.#text: The term
The term
has completed an accredited masters program in architecture; or

is an intern architect who has completed an accredited masters program in architecture and is
			 enrolled in the Intern Development Program of the National Council of
			 Architectural Registration Boards.

term.#tail:
means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and any territory or possession of the
			 United States.

			 necessary, to remain available until expended
